meanings.definition: Covered with short, stiff hairs or bristles
meanings.sent1: The cat's stubbled fur felt rough to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's hands were stubbled from working in the fields all day.
meanings.sent3: The stubbled surface of the velcro made it difficult to attach.
meanings.sent4: The stubbled ground resembled a prickly carpet underfoot.
meanings.sent5: The stubbled texture of the pineapple skin reminded her of a porcupine.

meanings.definition: Having a short growth of beard or hair
meanings.sent1: His stubbled chin gave him a rugged look.
meanings.sent2: After a few days without shaving, his face became stubbled.
meanings.sent3: The stubbled cheeks of the baby made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The stubbled face in the mirror looked back at him tiredly.
meanings.sent5: The stubbled beard added character to his otherwise clean-cut appearance.

meanings.definition: Covered with short, stiff stalks or stems
meanings.sent1: The stubbled wheat fields swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The stubbled stems of the flowers added texture to the bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The stubbled branches of the tree looked like tiny spikes.
meanings.sent4: The stubbled plants in the garden rustled softly in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The stubbled stems of the cactus were a natural defense mechanism.
